knimeNode.name: QVX Writer
knimeNode.shortDescription: Reads a data table from the input port and produces a Qvx file.

intro.p: Writes Qvx files. Upon executing, the node will read the data table on the in-port. The node will write the appropriate table header information header information for the Qvx file, and then write the data portion of the Qvx file based on the data table.

tab.name: Settings
tab.option: Enter a valid file name, or select a file from the "Browse" dialog. The supported file format is .qvx.
Table name of the Qvx file.
Decide whether an existing file should be overwritten on execution, or if execution should be aborted.

tab.name: Field Attributes
tab.option: Name of the column of the input data table, which will also be the name of the corresponding column in the Qvx file.
Specifies how QlikView should interpret the data values in the Qvx file.
For the Field Attribute of "FIX", specifies number of decimal places. For the Field Attribute of "REAL", specifies the number of significant digits.

tab.name: Advanced
tab.option: Specifies if a record separator byte should be written before each record.
Specifies the byte-order of the numerical data values within the Qvx file.

ports.inPort: Data table that will be used to generate the Qvx file.

views.view: Choose where the Qvx file will be saved and set whether or not an existing Qvx file should be overwritten.
Field Attributes specify how QlikView would interpret the data in the output qvx file. For instance, decimal values can be interpreted as money.
Toggle settings that affect the structure of the data in the output Qvx file. These settings have no effect on the actual data values that are stored in the Qvx file.
